'''Herdier''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ハーデリア''' ''Herderrie'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Lillipup}} starting at [[level]] 16 and evolves into {{p|Stoutland}} starting at level 32.

==Biology==
Herdier is a light brown, canine Pokémon with a short snout. Its face has long, cream fur, which forms a mustache and a three-pointed crest. Its ears are large and perked, and it has a black nose. It has shaggy dark blue fur covering its body and short tail. This hard, thick fur serves to protect Herdier from attacks. It has four short legs, with three-toed paws. Each paw has a dark blue paw pad that can be seen in [[Pokédex 3D Pro]]. Herdier is very loyal, and it will help its {{pkmn|Trainer}} raise other Pokémon. It has helped Trainers since long ago.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Lusamine Herdier.png|thumb|left|250px|Herdier in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
Herdier debuted in ''[[BW016|Rematch at the Nacrene Gym!]]'', under the ownership of [[Lenora]]. It battled against {{Ash}} and his {{AP|Tepig}}, but it was eventually defeated by Tepig's {{m|Flame Charge}}.

A Herdier appeared under the ownership of [[Officer Jenny]] in ''[[BW022|A Venipede Stampede!]]'' and ''[[BW052|Ash Versus the Champion!]]''.

A Herdier appeared in ''[[BW111|There's a New Gym Leader in Town!]]'', under the ownership of [[Cheren]]. It defeated {{Ash}}'s {{AP|Oshawott}} in a battle.

A Herdier appeared in ''[[SM046|Deceiving Appearances!]]'', under the ownership of [[Lusamine]].

====Minor appearances====
A Herdier was seen being defeated by [[Alder]]'s {{p|Bouffalant}} during a flashback in ''[[BW031|Ash and Trip's Third Battle!]]''.

A Herdier appeared in ''[[M14|White—Victini and Zekrom and Black—Victini and Reshiram]]''.

Herdier made cameo appearances in ''[[BW067|Cilan Takes Flight!]]'' and ''[[BW069|Climbing the Tower of Success!]]''.

A Herdier appeared in ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]'', under the ownership of {{un|Kanata}}. It was seen battling and losing against [[Misaki]]'s {{p|Liepard}} in the [[Roshan City]] [[Pokémon Center]]. Another Herdier appeared during the {{OBP|Swords of Justice|M15}} legend.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Herdier appeared in ''[[BW112|Team Plasma's Pokémon Power Plot!]]''.

A Herdier appeared in ''[[M16|Genesect and the Legend Awakened]]'' at [[Pokémon Hills]].

A Trainer's Herdier appeared in ''[[XY057|Thawing an Icy Panic!]]''.

Two Trainers' Herdier appeared in ''[[SM001|Alola to New Adventure!]]''.

A Trainer's Herdier appeared in ''[[SM006|A Shocking Grocery Run!]]''.

A Herdier appeared in ''[[SM011|Young Kiawe Had a Farm!]]'' at [[Paniola Ranch]], which is owned by {{an|Kiawe}}'s family. It was used by the family to herd all of the ranch's Pokémon.

A Trainer's Herdier appeared in ''[[SM013|Racing to a Big Event!]]'', where it participated in the [[Pokémon Pancake Race]].

Two Trainers' Herdier appeared in ''[[SM017|Crystal-Clear Sleuthing!]]''.

Two Trainers' Herdier appeared in ''[[SM021|One Journey Ends, Another Begins...]]''

A Trainer's Herdier appeared in ''[[SM023|Getting the Band Back Together!]]''.

A Trainer's Herdier appeared in ''[[SM027|A Glaring Rivalry!]]''.

A Herdier appeared in ''[[SM032|Treasure Hunt, Akala Style!]]''.

A Trainer's Herdier appeared in ''[[SM050|Faba's Revenge!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Lenora Lillipup Herdier Adventures.png|thumb|Herdier (middle) in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the [[Pokémon Adventures]] manga===
In ''[[PS462|Choices]]'', the man who delivers [[Professor Juniper]]'s package to {{adv|Black}} owns a Herdier.

A Trainer's Herdier appeared in ''[[PS466|An Odd Speech]]'' and ''[[PS513|Into the Quarterfinals!]]''.

[[Lenora]] has a {{p|Stoutland}} which she owned since it was a Lillipup. It was seen in a flashback in ''[[PS474|Defeating Stoutland]]''.

A Herdier appeared in ''[[PS483|Special Delivery]]'' as one of the Pokémon competing in {{ci|Nimbasa}}'s [[Pokémon Musical]].

==Trivia==
* Herdier is [[Mana Ibe]]'s favorite Pokémon.

===Origin===
Herdier is based on a {{wp|Yorkshire Terrier}} with some characteristics of {{wp|Scottish Terrier}}s and {{wp|Australian Silky Terrier}}s.

====Name origin====
Herdier and Herderrie may be a combination of ''{{wp|herd}}'' (as in {{wp|Herding dog|herding dogs}}) and ''{{wp|terrier}}''.
